concept.definition: dichotomous measure (present or absent) reported as a ratio compared to the denominator of 1 (A percentage is a proportion with denominator of 100).
A special use case where the proportion is derived from a formula rather than derived from summary evidence.
continuous numerical measure reported as an average.
continuous numerical measure reported as the middle of the range.
descriptive measure reported as total number of items.

description: Whether the risk estimate is dichotomous, continuous or qualitative and the specific type of risk estimate (eg proportion or median).
name: RiskEstimateType

text.div:
RiskEstimateType

Whether the risk estimate is dichotomous, continuous or qualitative and the specific type of risk estimate (eg proportion or median).

This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/risk-estimate-type defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
proportion proportiondichotomous measure (present or absent) reported as a ratio compared to the denominator of 1 (A percentage is a proportion with denominator of 100).
derivedProportion derivedProportionA special use case where the proportion is derived from a formula rather than derived from summary evidence.
mean meancontinuous numerical measure reported as an average.
median mediancontinuous numerical measure reported as the middle of the range.
count countdescriptive measure reported as total number of items.
descriptive descriptivedescriptive measure reported as narrative.

title: RiskEstimateType
